daa.practice1.randomaccessmachine.memory

Class InfiniteMemory<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • daa.practice1.randomaccessmachine.memory.InfiniteMemory<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataMemory, ProgramMemory

    public abstract class InfiniteMemory<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    InfiniteMemory is an abstract class that simulates an infinite TreeMap. The subclasses of InfiniteMemory must implement a getter and a setter of that TreeMap.
    Since:
    12-2-2018
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    √Ångel Igareta

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int MAX_CAPACITY
      Constant that defines the minimum value of the memory to simulate the infinity.
      protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,T> memory
      Generic TreeMap.

      Abstract Method that subclasses must implement to specify how a data in the register can be accessed.

      • InfiniteMemory

        protected InfiniteMemory()
        Constructor of the InfiniteMemory class. It creates the instance of the generic TreeMap.

    • Method Detail

      • getMemoryPosition

        protected int getMemoryPosition(int index)
        Method that uses a hashCode to assign an index to an position in the memory. It uses the module type.
        Parameters:
        index - The cyclic index.
        Returns:
        The hash position that matches the index passed by argument.

      • getRegisterAt

        protected abstract T getRegisterAt(int index)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Abstract Method that subclasses must implement to specify how a data in the register can be accessed.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the register.
        Returns:
        Data at the memory index passed by argument.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • setRegisterAt

        protected abstract void setRegisterAt(int index,
                                      T data)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Abstract Method that subclasses must implement to specify how a data in the register can be accessed and changed.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the register.
        data - Data that has to be at the memory index passed by argument.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
